017package org.apache.commons.chain.generic;
018
019import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertEquals;
020import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertFalse;
021import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertNotNull;
022import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertTrue;
023import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.fail;
024
025import org.apache.commons.chain.Catalog;
026import org.apache.commons.chain.CatalogFactory;
027import org.apache.commons.chain.Context;
028import org.apache.commons.chain.impl.CatalogBase;
029import org.apache.commons.chain.impl.ChainBase;
030import org.apache.commons.chain.impl.ContextBase;
031import org.apache.commons.chain.impl.DelegatingCommand;
032import org.apache.commons.chain.impl.NonDelegatingCommand;
033import org.junit.jupiter.api.AfterEach;
034import org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeEach;
035import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
036
037/**
038 * Test case for the {@code LookupCommand} class.
039 *
040 * @author Sean Schofield
041 * @version $Revision$
042 */
043public class LookupCommandTestCase {
044
045    // ---------------------------------------------------- Instance Variables
046
047    /**
048     * The instance of {@link Catalog} to use when looking up commands
049     */
050    protected Catalog<Context> catalog;
051
052    /**
053     * The {@link LookupCommand} instance under test.
054     */
055    protected LookupCommand<Context> command;
056
057    /**
058     * The {@link Context} instance on which to execute the chain.
059     */
060    protected Context context = null;
061
062    // -------------------------------------------------- Overall Test Methods
063
064    /**
065     * Set up instance variables required by this test case.
066     */
067    @BeforeEach
068    public void init() {
069        catalog = new CatalogBase<>();
070        CatalogFactory.getInstance().setCatalog(catalog);
071        command = new LookupCommand<>();
072        context = new ContextBase();
073    }
074
075    /**
076     * Tear down instance variables required by this test case.
077     */
078    @AfterEach
079    public void tearDown() {
080        catalog = null;
081        CatalogFactory.clear();
082        command = null;
083        context = null;
084    }
085
086    // ------------------------------------------------ Individual Test Methods
087
088    /**
089     * Test ability to lookup and execute single non-delegating command
090     */
091    @Test
092    public void testExecuteMethodLookup_1a() {
093        // use default catalog
094        catalog.addCommand("foo", new NonDelegatingCommand("1a"));
095        command.setName("foo");
096
097        try {
098            assertTrue(command.execute(context),
099                       "Command should return true");
100        } catch (Exception e) {
101            fail("Threw exception: " + e);
102        }
103        checkExecuteLog("1a");
104    }
105
106    /**
107     * Test ability to lookup and execute a chain
108     */
109    @Test
110    public void testExecuteMethodLookup_1b() {
111        ChainBase<Context> chain = new ChainBase<>();
112        chain.addCommand(new DelegatingCommand("1b1"));
113        chain.addCommand(new DelegatingCommand("1b2"));
114        chain.addCommand(new NonDelegatingCommand("1b3"));
115
116        // use default catalog
117        catalog.addCommand("foo", chain);
118        command.setName("foo");
119
120        try {
121            assertTrue(command.execute(context),
122                       "Command should return true");
123        } catch (Exception e) {
124            fail("Threw exception: " + e);
125        }
126        checkExecuteLog("1b1/1b2/1b3");
127    }
128
129    /**
130     * Test ability to lookup and execute single non-delegating command
131     * using the context
132     */
133    @Test
134    public void testExecuteMethodLookup_2a() {
135        // use default catalog
136        catalog.addCommand("foo", new NonDelegatingCommand("2a"));
137        command.setNameKey("nameKey");
138        context.put("nameKey", "foo");
139
140        try {
141            assertTrue(command.execute(context),
142                       "Command should return true");
143        } catch (Exception e) {
144            fail("Threw exception: " + e);
145        }
146        checkExecuteLog("2a");
147    }
148
149    /**
150     * Test ability to lookup and execute a chain using the context
151     */
152    @Test
153    public void testExecuteMethodLookup_2b() {
154        ChainBase<Context> chain = new ChainBase<>();
155        chain.addCommand(new DelegatingCommand("2b1"));
156        chain.addCommand(new DelegatingCommand("2b2"));
157        chain.addCommand(new NonDelegatingCommand("2b3"));
158
159        // use default catalog
160        catalog.addCommand("foo", chain);
161        command.setNameKey("nameKey");
162        context.put("nameKey", "foo");
163
164        try {
165            assertTrue(command.execute(context),
166                       "Command should return true");
167        } catch (Exception e) {
168            fail("Threw exception: " + e);
169        }
170        checkExecuteLog("2b1/2b2/2b3");
171    }
172
173    /**
174     * Test ability to lookup and execute single non-delegating command, ignoring its result
175     */
176    @Test
177    public void testExecuteMethodLookup_3a() {
178        // use default catalog
179        catalog.addCommand("foo", new NonDelegatingCommand("3a"));
180        command.setIgnoreExecuteResult(true);
181        command.setName("foo");
182
183        try {
184            assertFalse(command.execute(context),
185                        "Command should return false");
186        } catch (Exception e) {
187            fail("Threw exception: " + e);
188        }
189        checkExecuteLog("3a");
190    }
191
192    // -------------------------------------------------------- Support Methods
193
194    /**
195     * Verify the contents of the execution log
196     *
197     * @param expected the expected value
198     */
199    protected void checkExecuteLog(String expected) {
200        StringBuffer log = (StringBuffer) context.get("log");
201        assertNotNull(log, "Context failed to return log");
202        assertEquals(expected, log.toString(),
203                     "Context returned correct log");
204    }
205}
